kb_knowledge.author: 6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441
kb_knowledge.meta_description: SHAREPOINT AS AN A-IT SOLUTION: With the increasing need to remove all Unauthorized Information
kb_knowledge.text:
SHAREPOINT AS AN A-IT SOLUTION:

With the increasing need to remove all Unauthorized Information Technology (U-IT) from the DFAS network, the migration of U-IT to an Authorized IT (A-IT) environment is becoming more apparent and necessary. SharePoint is one of the A-IT solutions available for those looking to move their processes to an Authority to Operate (ATO) Boundary. What makes SharePoint a viable A-IT solution is that it has an ATO within the agency and its environment will be able to safeguard its applications data on the DISA mil cloud.

 

SHAREPOINT USED FOR:

The general term “SharePoint” is often used when referring to any of several online applications for which the underlying software is Microsoft SharePoint. However, the functionality may vary between environments, as there are several versions of SharePoint and certain environments may not utilize all services with which SharePoint can integrate.

Although there may be several versions of SharePoint, this Knowledge Article pertains specifically to the DFAS Portal.

 

· DFAS Portal: DFAS manages a SharePoint on-premise environment known as the DFAS Portal. The DFAS Portal is the Agency's integrated environment for accessing information, conducting business, and managing operations. DFAS organizations can create Enterprise sites to communicate mission and objectives throughout the agency or create Team sites to collaborate within their business areas. Approved use of this environment is covered under the DFAS Portal Governance Plan: https://dfasportal.dfas.mil/docs/Documents/Information%20Technology/Systems/DFAS%20Portal/DFAS%20Portal%20Governance%20Plan.pdf.

 

IS SHAREPOINT A GOOD FIT?

SharePoint is a website-based collaboration system that uses workflow applications, “list” databases, and other web parts and security features to empower business teams to work together. SharePoint also gives the company using the platform the ability to control access to information and automate workflow processes across business units. At DFAS, SharePoint is used for the DFAS Portal which is used as an online collaboration environment for DFAS teams to manage content and tasks, share files, and engage in discussions.

When evaluating migrating from your U-IT to SharePoint, you should consider the following:

1. Is there a need for role-based capabilities?

a. SharePoint can assign different roles and tasks depending on the permission level granted to users.

2. Is there a need for the automation of scheduling tasks?

a. SharePoint can generate tasks based on the actions of users via workflow automation.

3. Is there a need for notification alerts to be sent to the users?

a. Timed email reminders are available for use but require a workflow, and policies depending on the organization, to be built in to send notifications to be sent on specific dates.

4. Is there a need for shared visibility of updates?

a. History of changes in SharePoint are tracked but must be manually accessed since there is no built-in reporting mechanism to export such data.

5. Is there a need for the ability to reroute information/data?

a. SharePoint can reassign tasks manually or automatically via simple rules programmed by the user.

6. Is there a need for external user access?

a. Open to NIPR/.mil users

b. Users must first register for an account

7. Is there a need for segregation of duties?

a. SharePoint has the ability to set up different roles to allow for different users to have different access to content or tools, based on the needs

8. Is there a need for data retention?

a. Data in SharePoint is stored for a limited amount of time, approximately 2 months.

b. Information Management Policy with retention rules is possible.

 

CAPABILITIES:

Document Management

and Collaboration

· Versioning

· Coauthoring

· Metadata

· Search

· Integration with Microsoft Office suite

Web Content Management

· Web page creation

· Rich-text formatting

· Content moderation

· User feedback/comments

· Branding

Task Tracking

· Assigning tasks to users or groups

· Tracking due dates and status

· Microsoft Project integration

Data Collection and Reporting

· Customizable data fields

· Real-time user input

· Export to Excel

Scheduling

· Calendar view

· Limited resource reservations

· Outlook integration

Workflow

 

· Automated emails

· Rules and conditions

· Activities and approvals

Registration

· Web forms and validation

· Event planning

· Notifications

 

LIMITATIONS:

There are, however, limitations either inherent in the software or with respect to policy, which may prohibit using SharePoint to replace a U-IT function. We recommend reviewing the governance plan for each environment before developing any solution.

DFAS Portal Limitations include:

· Classified data is strictly prohibited.

· PII must be encrypted, secured via managed SharePoint groups, and deleted when no longer required.

· Cannot be the sole source or system of record. The DFAS Portal may be used as a temporary storage if necessary, to improve or enhance a business process.

· Cannot be used in a manner where data integrity issues may result in inaccurate finance or accounting-related activities.

· Cannot be used in cases where near 100% availability is required.

· Should not be used for data collections of more than 10,000 active records. If over 10,000, there must be a process established for archiving or splitting the data.

· An individual list/app should not exceed 200 transactions per day.

· An individual site cannot exceed 10 Gb in size, including any future growth.

· An individual file cannot exceed 100 Mb in size.

· An individual team site cannot exceed 500 members. Enterprise or large communications sites can be opened more widely to a read-only audience.

· Access to the environment is CAC-enabled and restricted to DoD.

· Cannot directly interface data with another A-IT system.

· Cannot interface with a separate U-IT application. U-IT cannot not rely on data created or updated within the DFAS Portal.

· Cannot be used to explicitly circumvent controls within another system. Gaining access to the authorized system of record is preferred.

· Should not be used to create complex data relationships or tables.

· Should not be used to create complex data validation. The data validation capabilities are limited to required fields, data types, or limited rules. Complex validation between multiple records is not supported.

· Cannot perform complex calculation. Calculations on lists are limited to basic arithmetic. Complex calculations across data sets are not supported.

 

 

SHAREPOINT PROCESS – Getting Started:

The process of migrating U-IT to the SharePoint platform involves:

1) Citizen Developer registers their U-IT application in the MARRT.

a) MARRT link: Unauthorized IT - All Items (dfas.mil)

2) Citizen Developer identifies need to migrate a new or existing U-IT to SharePoint.

3) Citizen Developer begins taking necessary SharePoint training available on the DFAS SkillPort-DFAS eLearning Center located here:

a) Basic User – https://dfas.skillport.com/skillportfe/main.action?path=summary/LP/lp_sp2013eu

i) Classes include:

My Site and Social Features in SharePoint 2013

Navigating, Lists, Libraries, Alerts, and Document Sets in SharePoint 2013

Managing Web Parts, Users, and Groups in SharePoint 2013

Configuring Pages, Sites, and Content in SharePoint 2013

Configuring Lists, Libraries, E-mail, and Announcements in SharePoint 2013

Community Sites, Search, and Office Integration in SharePoint 2013

Managing Libraries and Lists in SharePoint 2016

b) Power User – https://dfas.skillport.com/skillportfe/main.action?path=summary/LP/lp_sp2013pu

c) Registration/Login Form (skillport.com)

 

 

 

U-IT FUNCTIONAL NEEDS AND A-IT SOLUTIONS

Existing U-IT applications within the operational areas across DFAS were evaluated for functional need requirements. Six major categories of functional needs were identified: Workload Management, Workflow, Ticketing, Data Reconciliation, Data Analytics, and Data Transformation.

The current five A-IT solutions (ACL (DTPAT) Server, Cognos, SharePoint, Oracle Apex, and Advana) provided scores to reflect the software’s ability to meet the specific functional needs. Scores were obtained in three areas: capability, skill set, and coding. The scores are intended to serve as a guide during the process of exploring possible A-IT solutions. Higher scores indicated increased feasibility that the A-IT solution will be a suitable option to meet the functional needs.

 

 

 

HOW DO I GET MORE INFORMATION ON SHAREPOINT/TRAINING?

DFAS Portal:

· DFAS Portal Help Center – https://dfasportal.dfas.mil/help

SkillPort Training

· Basic User – https://dfas.skillport.com/skillportfe/main.action?path=summary/LP/lp_sp2013eu

· Power User – https://dfas.skillport.com/skillportfe/main.action?path=summary/LP/lp_sp2013pu
